data.title: Former Twitter employees accused of spying for Saudi Arabia
data.text: Ex-Twitter employees are accused of spying on thousands of Twitter users for the Saudi Government.

data.title: Why Spy on Twitter? For Saudi Arabia, It’s the Town Square
data.text: The indictment of two former Twitter employees accused of spying for the Saudis highlights the platform’s power and the kingdom’s efforts to control it.

data.title: Twitter Faces Increased Pressure Over its Ad Sales and Policies
data.text: Twitter's stock has been struggling since it reported lackluster Q3 ad sales and announced a ban on political ads.

data.title: Twitter has reached peak margins, says Evercore analyst
data.text: Evercore ISI downgrades Twitter after two employees were charged with aiding Saudi Arabia in a spy mission. Kevin Rippey, the analyst behind the call, joins CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to discuss.

data.title: Twitter downgraded to underperform at Evercore on rising cost concers
data.text: The "Halftime Report" traders debate Evercore's bearish call on Twitter.

data.title: EU's Vestager backs Twitter for banning political ads, berates Facebook
data.text: Europe's antitrust chief praised Twitter on Thursday for banning political advertising but criticized Facebook, which will continue to run such ads, for its "de facto manipulation of who you're going to vote for".

data.title: NYT's Farhad Manjoo: Lack of clarity makes it hard to ban political ads
data.text: Farhad Manjoo of NYT and Bethany McLean of Vanity Fair join "Squawk Alley" to discuss moves by tech companies to ban political ads as well as allegations two former Twitter employees spied for Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Twitter's new feature corrals tweets by topic
data.text: The Topics feature launches this week.

data.title: Evercore Downgrades Twitter, Expects High R&D Spend Before Recovery
data.text: Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR) shares have fallen 35% from their 2019 high, but one team of analysts thinks things could still get worse.

data.title: DoJ Says 2 Former Twitter Employees Spied On Critics Of Saudi Crown
data.text: The U.S. Justice Department has charged two former Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR) employees with spying on Saudi Arabian dissidents.

data.title: Facebook vs. Twitter: Whose Political Ad Strategy Has More Flaws?
data.text: Jack Dorsey, founder and CEO of Twitter Inc. (NYSE:TWTR), shocked media mavens and market movers alike with his surprise announcement that the popular social media platform would no longer permit paid political advertising.

data.title: Twitter stock falls after Evercore turns bearish
data.text: Shares of Twitter Inc. TWTR, -0.91% are off 1.6% in premarket trading Thursday after Evercore ISI analyst Kevin Rippey cut his rating on the stock to underperform from in-line.

data.title: Tumbling Twitter shares downgraded on concern about rising costs
data.text: Evercore ISI downgraded Twitter to underperform from in line and slashed its price target to $25 per share from $42 per share.

data.title: The EU's next move to rein in tech giants could be regulation on political ads
data.text: A top EU official weighed in on the debate over political ads on tech platforms Thursday, telling CNBC that European lawmakers will determine the rules while companies including Facebook and Twitter must obey them.
